member.name: T:SharePointPnP.Modernization.Framework.Functions.XmlComparer
member.summary:
Loosely compares XML documents for equality:
Order of siblings in an element is ignored.
Text nodes are the only node in at the bottom of the tree so sibling text nodes are merged for comparison.
The prefix used for a namespace is ignored.
Comments are ignored.
This type of comparison is useful when comparing the XML documents used as messages, configuration, etc. in various specifications.

member.name: T:SharePointPnP.Modernization.Framework.Functions.XmlEqualityResult
member.summary: The result of an equiality comparison with

member.name: P:SharePointPnP.Modernization.Framework.Functions.XmlEqualityResult.Success
member.summary: Gets whether the match was successful

member.name: P:SharePointPnP.Modernization.Framework.Functions.XmlEqualityResult.FailObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that failed the match

member.name: P:SharePointPnP.Modernization.Framework.Functions.XmlEqualityResult.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets a descriptive error message if the match failed.
member.remarks: If set to null or not set the default Error Message is returned.

member.summary: Configuration driven by the presence of a modernization center

member.summary: If true images and videos embedded in wiki text will be transformed to actual image/video web parts, else they'll get a placeholder and will be added as separate web parts at the end of the page

member.summary: If the page to be transformed is the web's home page then replace with stock modern home page instead of transforming it

member.summary: Translated SharePoint Wiki background color number (ms-rtebackcolor-5 means number 5 is used) to RTE compatible color name
member.param: Used color number

member.summary: Recursively loop the blockquote elements until we're at the top level, returns needed information to process: - Level: how many indents where used - TopLevelBlockQuote: what is the top level blockquote that we'll be using as "replacement node" - If there already was a container created to store content at this level then let's return that one - If by walking the blockquote tree we see strike through being used then indicate that - If by walking the blockquote tree we see underline being used then indicate that

member.name: T:SharePointPnP.Modernization.Framework.Transform.SummaryLinksHtmlTransformator
member.summary: This class is used to rewrite the html coming out of the SummaryLinks web part

member.name: M:SharePointPnP.Modernization.Framework.Transform.SummaryLinksHtmlTransformator.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:SharePointPnP.Modernization.Framework.Transform.SummaryLinksHtmlTransformator.Transform(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Transforms the passed summarylinks html to be usable by the client side text part
member.param: Summarylinks html to be transformed
member.returns: Html that can be used and edited via the client side text part

member.name: T:SharePointPnP.Modernization.Framework.Transform.TokenParser
member.summary: Resolves tokens by their actual representation

member.name: M:SharePointPnP.Modernization.Framework.Transform.TokenParser.ReplaceTokens(System.String,SharePointPnP.Modernization.Framework.Entities.WebPartEntity)
member.summary: Replaces the tokens in the provided input string with their values
member.param: String with tokens
Web part information holding all possible tokens for this web part
member.returns: A string with tokens replaced by actual values

member.name: M:SharePointPnP.Modernization.Framework.Transform.WikiTransformatorSimple.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:SharePointPnP.Modernization.Framework.Transform.WikiTransformatorSimple.TransformPlusSplit(System.Collections.Generic.List{SharePointPnP.Modernization.Framework.Entities.WebPartEntity},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Replaces embedded images and iframes with respective "fake" image and video web parts. Depending on the image/iframe position in the html the wiki text is broken up in multiple wiki text parts intermixed with image and/or video parts. Later on these web parts will be transformed to client side web parts
member.param: List of web parts on the page

member.name: T:SharePointPnP.Modernization.Framework.WebParts
member.summary: Web part type constants

member.name: T:CamlBuilder.FieldReference
member.summary: Represents a reference to a field within a query.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.Alias
member.summary: Field alias.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.Ascending
member.summary: This specifies the sort order on a FieldRef.
member.remarks: Query defaults this to true when no value is specified.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.CreateUrl
member.summary: Specifies the URL for the .aspx file that is used to create a Meeting Workspace site.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.DisplayName
member.summary: This attribute provides the display name of the field that is referenced.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.Explicit
member.summary: This attribute is only supported within the ViewFields element. True if the field is explicitly declared in the view definition and is not returned in a Fields enumeration inside a view.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.Format
member.summary: Field format.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.Id
member.summary: Specifies the GUID that identifies the field.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.Key
member.summary: If set to Primary, specifies that the field is the primary key for its table and thus uniquely identifies each record in the table.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.List
member.summary: Specifies the parent foreign list when the FieldRef element is a child of an Eq element in Join element. The value is an alias for the list that is defined by the ListAlias attribute of the Join element

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.LookupId
member.summary: When the field is a Lookup type, specifies that queries should look for the item by its unique item ID rather than the field value. This can be useful, for example, when multiple items have identical values in the field and you want to query for a specific item.
member.remarks: Query default this to false when no value is specified

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.Name
member.summary: This attribute provides the internal name of the field that is referenced.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.RefType
member.summary: Specifies the type of reference for a field in an events list.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.ShowField
member.summary: The ShowField attribute can be set to the field name to display. By default, a hyperlinked text from the Title field of the record in the external list is displayed. But the ShowField attribute can be used to override that and display another field from the external list.
member.remarks: The following data types are allowed as targets of a ShowField attribute: Text, Choice, and Counter.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.TextOnly
member.summary: Specifies that the field contains only text values.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.Type
member.summary: Specifies the function that is applied to a totals column or a calculated column.

member.name: M:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of FieldReference with all it's properties set to default.

member.name: M:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of FieldReference with the initial specified .
member.param: Internal name of the field.

member.name: M:CamlBuilder.FieldReference.op_Implicit(System.String)~CamlBuilder.FieldReference
member.summary: Uses as a field reference internal name and returns a new .
member.param: String to be used as FieldReference internal name.

member.name: T:CamlBuilder.FieldReferenceFunctionType
member.summary: Specifies the function that is applied to a totals column or a calculated column.

member.name: T:CamlBuilder.ListPropertyValueItem
member.summary: Represents an item to be used by ListProperty value.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.ListPropertyValueItem.AutoHyperLink
member.summary: True to surround text with anchor tags if the text appears like a hyperlink, for example, www.microsoft.com.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.ListPropertyValueItem.AutoHyperLinkNoEncoding
member.summary: True to surround text with anchor tags if the text appears like a hyperlink (for example, www.microsoft.com) but without HTML encoding.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.ListPropertyValueItem.Default
member.summary: Sets the default ProgID for the application that created the list.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.ListPropertyValueItem.ExpandXml
member.summary: True to re-pass the rendered content through the Collaborative Application Markup Language (CAML) interpreter, which allows CAML to render CAML.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.ListPropertyValueItem.HtmlEncode
member.summary: True to convert embedded characters so that they are displayed as text in the browser. In other words, characters that could be confused with HTML tags are converted to entities.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.ListPropertyValueItem.Select
member.summary: Specifies a field in the List of Lists table.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.ListPropertyValueItem.StripWs
member.summary: True to remove white space from the beginning and end of the value returned by the element.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.ListPropertyValueItem.UrlEncode
member.summary: True to convert special characters, such as spaces, to quoted UTF-8 format, for example, %c3%ab for character .

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.ListPropertyValueItem.UrlEncodeAsUrl
member.summary: Like URLEncode, but true to specify that the string to encode is a path component of a URL and not to encode the forward slash (/).

member.name: M:CamlBuilder.ListPropertyValueItem.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of ListPropertyValueItem with initial specified
member.param: Specifies a field in the List of Lists table.

member.name: T:CamlBuilder.Value
member.summary: Defines a CAML value. This class has no constructors available.To instanciate a new value use public static methods.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.Value.Type
member.summary: Specifies the data type for the value contained by this element.

member.name: P:CamlBuilder.Value.IncludeTimeValue
member.summary: Specifies to build DateTime queries based on time as well as date. If you do not set this attribute, the time portion of queries that involve date and time are ignored.

member.name: M:CamlBuilder.Value.Now
member.summary: Value representng the current date and time.
member.returns: Value representng the current date and time.

member.name: M:CamlBuilder.Value.Now(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Value representing the current date and time.
member.param: True if is to be included the time part; otherwise, false
member.returns: Value representng the current date and time.

member.name: M:CamlBuilder.Value.Month
member.summary:
Value representing the current month.
Can be used in together with operator to retrieve from a calendar all instances of a recurring event that occur within a month.

member.name: M:CamlBuilder.Value.Month(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Can be used in together with operator to retrieve from a calendar all instances of a recurring event that occur within a month.
member.param: True if is to be included the time part; otherwise, false

member.name: M:CamlBuilder.Value.Today
member.summary:
Value representing the current day.
Renders the current date in the format that is relative to the server's local time zone. For servers in the United States, the format is MM/DD/YYYY (for example, 1/21/2001).

member.name: M:CamlBuilder.Value.Today(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Value representing the current day.
Renders the current date in the format that is relative to the server's local time zone. For servers in the United States, the format is MM/DD/YYYY (for example, 1/21/2001).
member.param: Adds or subtracts the number of days that are specified by the positive or negative integer value.

member.name: M:CamlBuilder.Value.Today(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Value representing the current day.
Renders the current date in the format that is relative to the server's local time zone. For servers in the United States, the format is MM/DD/YYYY (for example, 1/21/2001).
member.param: True if is to be included the time part; otherwise, false

member.name: M:CamlBuilder.Value.Today(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Value representing the current day.
Renders the current date in the format that is relative to the server's local time zone. For servers in the United States, the format is MM/DD/YYYY (for example, 1/21/2001).
member.param: True if is to be included the time part; otherwise, false
Adds or subtracts the number of days that are specified by the positive or negative integer value.
